header: =1= ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 IN CRI. MISC. APPLICATION No. 119/2019 (Vimal Dattatraya Takale Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01-000614-2019

background.text: 1) Application is filed by the applicant under section 438 of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973 apprehending her arrest as a result of complaint dated 14.02.2019 (C.R.No. 108/2019 of Satara City Police Station) filed by one Tushar Chandrakant Kothavale suspecting applicant's involvement behind suicidal death of his sister Dhanashri.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 438 of criminal procedure code

arguments.text: 3) It is contended that, deceased Dhanshri is daughter­ in­law of present applicant, who committed suicide by hanging herself. It is alleged that, applicant and her son mentally and physically harassed the deceased in order to fulfill their illegal demand of Rs.3,00,000/­ and they abetted her to commit suicide.

argumentSentences.text: 3) It is contended that, deceased Dhanshri is daughter­ in­law of present applicant, who committed suicide by hanging herself.
It is alleged that, applicant and her son mentally and physically harassed the deceased in order to fulfill their illegal demand of Rs.3,00,000/­ and they abetted her to commit suicide.

arguments.text: 4) It is contended that, applicant, her husband and her mother­in­law are residing at Aravi, Taluka Koregaon and deceased alongwith her husband and children was residing separately at Satara. The present applicant has no concerned with the crime. Applicant never demanded money from the deceased, husband of deceased is high school teacher has no need to compel deceased to bring money from her maternal home, so the demand of dowry is false. It is further contended that, applicant is of 72 years old, suffering from High blood pressure and always remain sick, hence prayed for anticipatory bail.

argumentSentences.text: 4) It is contended that, applicant, her husband and her mother­in­law are residing at Aravi, Taluka Koregaon and deceased alongwith her husband and children was residing separately at Satara.
The present applicant has no concerned with the crime.
Applicant never demanded money from the deceased, husband of deceased is high school teacher has no need to compel deceased to bring money from her maternal home, so the demand of dowry is false.
It is further contended that, applicant is of 72 years old, suffering from High blood pressure and always remain sick, hence prayed for anticipatory bail.

arguments.text: 5) Application is strongly opposed on the grounds that, applicant alongwith her son since 2000 from time to time harassed the deceased for fulfillment of their unlawful demand. It is alleged that, informant has given 5 lakhs Rupees to applicants, but again started demanding 3 lakhs from the deceased and that reason applicant was harassing the deceased alongwith her son. Accordingly, they both abetted the suicide of the deceased. It is further stated that, investigation is just started and applicant was absconding since registration of the crime, hence prayed for rejection of the application.

argumentSentences.text: 5) Application is strongly opposed on the grounds that, applicant alongwith her son since 2000 from time to time harassed the deceased for fulfillment of their unlawful demand.
It is alleged that, informant has given 5 lakhs Rupees to applicants, but again started demanding 3 lakhs from the deceased and that reason applicant was harassing the deceased alongwith her son.
Accordingly, they both abetted the suicide of the deceased.
It is further stated that, investigation is just started and applicant was absconding since registration of the crime, hence prayed for rejection of the application.

arguments.text: 6) As per FIR, deceased was married with the son of this applicant on 11th May, 2000. It is pointed out that, present applicant was never residing with the deceased and her husband who is in custody. They were residing at Satara for the education of children and this applicant is residing at village in Koregaon and she is unable to leave her place for the reason that, her husband is aged 78 years is with her and she was taking care of her mother­in­law who died recently in 2017.

argumentSentences.text: 6) As per FIR, deceased was married with the son of this applicant on 11th May, 2000.
It is pointed out that, present applicant was never residing with the deceased and her husband who is in custody.

They were residing at Satara for the education of children and this applicant is residing at village in Koregaon and she is unable to leave her place for the reason that, her husband is aged 78 years is with her and she was taking care of her mother­in­law who died recently in 2017.

arguments.text: 7) Considering age of the applicant and contents in FIR, interim protection already granted to the applicant may be confirmed. Hence the order.

argumentSentences.text: 7) Considering age of the applicant and contents in FIR, interim protection already granted to the applicant may be confirmed.

order.text: ORDER 1) Criminal Bail Application no. 119/2019 is allowed. 2) Interim pre­arrest bail order dated 16/02/2019 passed below Exh. 4, stands confirmed.

footer: (B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date : 5th March, 2019 Satara
processedText:
=1= ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 IN CRI. MISC. APPLICATION No. 119/2019 (Vimal Dattatraya Takale Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01-000614-2019 
---header-ends---
1) Application is filed by the applicant under section 438 of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973 apprehending her arrest as a result of complaint dated 14.02.2019 (C.R.No. 108/2019 of Satara City Police Station) filed by one Tushar Chandrakant Kothavale suspecting applicant's involvement behind suicidal death of his sister Dhanashri. 
---background-ends---
3) It is contended that, deceased Dhanshri is daughter­ in­law of present applicant, who committed suicide by hanging herself. It is alleged that, applicant and her son mentally and physically harassed the deceased in order to fulfill their illegal demand of Rs.3,00,000/­ and they abetted her to commit suicide. 
---argument-ends---
4) It is contended that, applicant, her husband and her mother­in­law are residing at Aravi, Taluka Koregaon and deceased alongwith her husband and children was residing separately at Satara. The present applicant has no concerned with the crime. Applicant never demanded money from the deceased, husband of deceased is high school teacher has no need to compel deceased to bring money from her maternal home, so the demand of dowry is false. It is further contended that, applicant is of 72 years old, suffering from High blood pressure and always remain sick, hence prayed for anticipatory bail. 
---argument-ends---
5) Application is strongly opposed on the grounds that, applicant alongwith her son since 2000 from time to time harassed the deceased for fulfillment of their unlawful demand. It is alleged that, informant has given 5 lakhs Rupees to applicants, but again started demanding 3 lakhs from the deceased and that reason applicant was harassing the deceased alongwith her son. Accordingly, they both abetted the suicide of the deceased. It is further stated that, investigation is just started and applicant was absconding since registration of the crime, hence prayed for rejection of the application. 
---argument-ends---
6) As per FIR, deceased was married with the son of this applicant on 11th May, 2000. It is pointed out that, present applicant was never residing with the deceased and her husband who is in custody. They were residing at Satara for the education of children and this applicant is residing at village in Koregaon and she is unable to leave her place for the reason that, her husband is aged 78 years is with her and she was taking care of her mother­in­law who died recently in 2017. 
---argument-ends---
7) Considering age of the applicant and contents in FIR, interim protection already granted to the applicant may be confirmed. Hence the order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1) Criminal Bail Application no. 119/2019 is allowed. 2) Interim pre­arrest bail order dated 16/02/2019 passed below Exh. 4, stands confirmed. 
---order-ends---
(B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date : 5th March, 2019 Satara
